title: Thanksgiving Celebration
text: Thanksgiving, celebrated on the fourth Thursday of November, is a major U.S. holiday centered around family, gratitude, and a traditional turkey dinner.

title: Dining Etiquette in the UK
text: Ordering food in English restaurants involves polite phrases and an appreciation for British dining customs, like afternoon tea.

title: Business Culture in the UK
text: British business English includes formal greetings and a culture of punctuality and professionalism in meetings.

title: Oktoberfest in Munich
text: Oktoberfest, held annually in Munich since 1810, is the world’s largest beer festival, featuring traditional Bavarian culture.

title: German Shopping Traditions
text: Shopping in Germany often involves local markets and a preference for quality goods, with phrases to negotiate prices.

title: German Business Etiquette
text: Formal German conversations emphasize directness, punctuality, and respect in professional settings.

title: Venice Carnival
text: The Carnival of Venice features elaborate masks and costumes, a tradition dating back to the 12th century.

text: Navigating Italian airports involves understanding local customs, like greeting staff politely.

title: Italian Idioms in Culture
text: Italian expressions like 'In bocca al lupo' reflect the rich cultural heritage of the language.

title: Fête de la Musique
text: Held every June 21 since 1982, this French festival fills streets with free music performances.

title: French Food Traditions
text: French cuisine includes bread, wine, and cheese, with unique dining etiquette to explore.

title: French Travel Customs
text: Traveling in France involves knowing phrases for trains, hotels, and local politeness.

title: La Tomatina
text: This annual tomato fight in Buñol, Spain, is a fun festival held every August.

title: Spanish Food Markets
text: Spanish food culture features vibrant markets with fresh ingredients and tapas traditions.

title: Traveling in Spain
text: Spanish travel involves navigating stations and hotels with local phrases and customs.

title: Carnival of Rio
text: The world’s largest carnival, held in Rio de Janeiro, features samba and vibrant parades.

text: Dining in Portugal includes ordering coffee and enjoying local seafood dishes.

text: Business in Portugal values formal greetings and relationship-building in meetings.

title: King’s Day
text: Celebrated on April 27, this Dutch festival features orange attire and street markets.

title: Dutch Cuisine
text: Dutch food includes iconic dishes like stroopwafels, herring, and bitterballen, enjoyed across the country.

title: Dutch Biking Culture
text: Cycling is a primary mode of transportation in the Netherlands and an iconic part of daily life.

title: Maslenitsa Festival
text: This Russian holiday marks the end of winter with pancakes and traditional games.

text: Visiting a Russian café involves ordering tea and enjoying local pastries.

title: Russian Ballet
text: Russia is famous for its classical ballet, with renowned institutions like the Bolshoi and Mariinsky.

title: Hanami Festival
text: Hanami is the Japanese tradition of cherry blossom viewing, celebrated in spring.

title: Japanese Food
text: Japanese cuisine includes dishes like sushi, ramen, and tempura, known for their delicate flavors and seasonal ingredients.

title: Japanese Tea Ceremony
text: The traditional tea ceremony in Japan reflects mindfulness, aesthetics, and harmony.

title: Chinese New Year
text: Celebrated with fireworks and red envelopes, this holiday marks the lunar new year.

text: Chinese dining features family-style meals and tea-serving customs.

title: The Great Wall
text: An iconic symbol of China, the Great Wall stretches thousands of kilometers with rich history.

title: Chuseok Festival
text: Chuseok, a Korean harvest festival, involves family gatherings and ancestral rites.

title: Korean food
text: Dining in Korea includes sharing dishes and respecting elders at the table.

title: K-Pop Culture
text: K-Pop has become a global phenomenon, blending catchy music, fashion, and choreography.
